intro: Senna huancabambae, commonly known as the Huancabamba senna, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant produces yellow flowers with prominent stamens, which are typical of the genus Senna. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple small leaflets, and it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
